examples.text: Can anyone give me an example of a transitive verb?

definition: a specific fact, idea, person, or thing that is used to explain or support a general idea, or to show what is typical of a larger group [example of]
a specific fact, idea, person, or thing that is used to explain or support a general idea, or to show what is typical of a larger group

examples.text: Can anyone give me an example of a transitive verb?

definition: for example [used before mentioning a specific thing, person, place etc in order to explain what you mean or to support an argument]

examples.text: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
Car prices can vary a lot. For example, in Belgium the VW Golf costs $1,000 less than in Britain.

definition: used before mentioning a specific thing, person, place etc in order to explain what you mean or to support an argument

examples.text: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
Car prices can vary a lot. For example, in Belgium the VW Golf costs $1,000 less than in Britain.

definition: [someone whose behaviour is very good and should be copied by others, or this type of behaviour]

examples.text: Parents should set an example for their children.
I suggest you follow Rosie's example(=copy her behaviour) and start doing regular exercise.
The team captain leads by example.
She's a shining example(=a very good example) of what a mother should be.

definition: someone whose behaviour is very good and should be copied by others, or this type of behaviour

examples.text: Parents should set an example for their children.
I suggest you follow Rosie's example(=copy her behaviour) and start doing regular exercise.
The team captain leads by example.
She's a shining example(=a very good example) of what a mother should be.
Her courage is an example to us all.
Her courage is an example to us all.

definition: someone whose behaviour is very good and should be copied by others, or this type of behaviour [example to]
